articles.title: Kim Jong Il Enjoys Performance Given by Military Families
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Enjoys Performance Given by Military Families
 Pyongyang, July 2 (KCNA) -- Supreme Commander of the Korean People's Army (KPA) Kim Jong Il watched an art performance given by military families of KPA Units 10215 and 963 and the Korean People's Internal Security Forces. They are taking part in the fourth second-term contest of art group members of the military families.
					 Colorful numbers included narrative and song "Our Unforgettable Leader", chorus "We Are the Happiest in the World", monodrama "Wishes", agitation poetic drama "We Are in Stand-off" and chorus "Glory to Our Great Party".
					
					 The performers sang highly of their worthwhile life full of pride, self-esteem, optimism and joy as women revolutionaries, staunch supporters of the party's Songun leadership. They also strikingly demonstrated the iron faith and will and the indomitable spirit of the military families to devotedly defend the headquarters of the revolution and accomplish the revolutionary cause of Juche in the same trench with their husbands.
					
					 The performance given by the second buglers of the Songun era was highly acclaimed by the audience as it would harden the army and people's spirit to devotedly defend the leader and the country and their towering hatred against confrontational maniacs as well as their pledge to take thousand-fold revenge against them.
					
					 At the end of the performance General Secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea and Chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK Kim Jong Il warmly acknowledged the cheering performers and audience and congratulated the performers.
					
					 He expressed great satisfaction over the fact that the art group members of the military families gave the performance which not only truthfully reflected their worthwhile life but is perfect in ideological and artistic values giving answers to important problems arising in the struggle and life of the people in the Songun era. He extended his special thanks to them.
					
					 The performance given by the art group members of military families of KPA Units 963 and 10215 sensibly reflected the WPK's policies to give good answers to important socio-political problems in the present times, he said, proposing to award a special prize.
					
					 Monodrama "Wishes" and all other numbers given by art group members of the military families of KPA Unit 963 touched the heartstrings of the audience and gave deep impression as the creators and the art group members conducted their creating activities while breathing the same air with the times and finding themselves among the stirring life, he said. He highly appreciated playwright Kim Kwon Il and art group member Paek Ryon Hui for their special merits in the creation.
					
					 Admirable indeed are the spiritual world and fighting and living traits of the military families living in a militant way full of confidence and optimism about the future, he said, calling on the society to learn from them.
					
					 The contest clearly manifested once again the validity and vitality of the WPK's literature and art policy on popularizing the arts and the advantage of the new culture created in the Songun era, he said, setting forth important tasks which would serve as guidelines in conducting more dynamic popular cultural and performing activities.
					
					 Watching the performance together with him were leading officials of the party and the armed forces including Kim Jong Un, Ri Yong Ho, Kim Ki Nam, Jang Song Thaek, Kim Jong Gak, U Tong Chuk, Kim Chang Sop and Ri Myong Su, Members of the Central Military Commission of the WPK Kim Kyong Ok, Kim Won Hong, Kim Yong Chol and Yun Jong Rin, and Department Director of the NDC Hyon Chol Hae.

articles.title: Choe Yong Rim Acquaints Himself with Electricity Production at Power Plant
articles.content:
Choe Yong Rim Acquaints Himself with Electricity Production at Power Plant
						
 Pyongyang, July 2 (KCNA) -- DPRK Premier Choe Yong Rim acquainted himself with electricity production at the Pukchang Thermal-power Complex on the spot.
					 The premier went round various places of the complex and held a consultative meeting.
					
					 The meeting took concrete measures to increase the power production including the issue of focusing efforts on the management of equipment and technical control and the need for the relevant units to provide sufficient quantities of necessary raw and other materials to the complex in good time.

articles.title: DPRK Delegations Leave for China
articles.content:
DPRK Delegations Leave for China
 Pyongyang, July 2 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the DPRK Red Cross Society headed by Paek Yong Ho, vice-chairman of its Central Committee, left here Saturday to attend a senior officials' meeting of Red Cross national organizations to be held in China.
					 Also leaving was a delegation of the Foreign Languages Publishing House headed by Choe Kyong Guk, its director and editor-in-chief, to visit China.

articles.title: DPRK, Syrian Cities Establish Friendship Relations
articles.content:
DPRK, Syrian Cities Establish Friendship Relations 
						
 Pyongyang, July 2 (KCNA) -- Kaesong City of the DPRK and Quneitra City of Syria established friendship relations on June 23.
					 An agreement on it was signed in Quneitra.
					
					 The DPRK ambassador to Syria and the governor of the Quneitra Province signed the agreement.

articles.title: Guatemalan President Hopes Development of Economic Relations with DPRK
articles.content:
Guatemalan President Hopes Development of Economic Relations with DPRK
 Pyongyang, July 2 (KCNA) -- Guatemalan President Alvaro Colom hoped Guatemala and the DPRK would develop economic relations and boost mutual assistance in the international arena, saying he is pleased over the successes made by the Korean people in building a thriving nation.
					 He met DPRK Ambassador to his country An Kun Song on June 22.
					
					 He wished the Korean people big success in their efforts to build a thriving nation and reunify the country.

articles.title: Chinese Tourist Group Arrives in Pyongyang
articles.content:
Chinese Tourist Group Arrives in Pyongyang
						
 Pyongyang, July 2 (KCNA) -- A tourist group of Shanghai people led by Shi Quanxing, chief of the Communist Party of China branch of the Shanghai Kumgang Tours Co. Ltd., arrived in Pyongyang by air on Friday.
					 It is the first Chinese tourist group to come to the DPRK through the Shanghai-Pyongyang air route. 
					
					 During five days and four nights, the tourists will visit monuments in Pyongyang, the International Friendship Exhibition House, Panmunjom and other places.
					
					 Mt. Kumgang, one of the world-famous mountains, and historic relics in Kaesong area are also included in their tourism program.
					
					 Jo Song Gyu, director of the Korean International Travel Company, told KCNA that an increasing number of Chinese people are expected to come for sightseeing in Mt. Kumgang and other tourist attractions in the DPRK.

articles.title: Russian Academy Ensemble Performs in Sariwon City
articles.content:
Russian Academy Ensemble Performs in Sariwon City
 Pyongyang, July 2 (KCNA) -- The Academy Ensemble of the Interior Unit of the Russian Ministry of Interior gave a performance at the North Hwanghae Provincial Art Theatre in Sariwon City on Saturday.
					 Among the audience were Ri Won Il, chairman of the North Hwanghae Provincial People's Committee, Kim Chang Ryong, secretary of the Provincial Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, writers, artistes, media persons, and teachers and students in the city. 
					
					 Its numbers included songs, orchestral music and dances.
					
					 In chorus and orchestral music "Warring People," dance "Dance of Soldiers" and others the performers truthfully represented the spiritual world of the Russian soldiers who bravely fought against aggressors. They also showed the peculiar emotion and optimistic life of the Russian people. 
					
					They enthusiastically sang Korean song "The General of Korea" with deep reverence for General Secretary Kim Jong Il to be highly acclaimed by the audience.
					
					  The performance continues.

articles.title: S. Korea Accused of Their Projects to Turn Islands in West Sea into Tourist Destinations
articles.content:
S. Korea Accused of Their Projects to Turn Islands in West Sea into Tourist Destinations
 Pyongyang, July 2 (KCNA) -- The south Korean puppet forces announced a plan to develop five islands in the West Sea into international tourist destinations.
					 Rodong Sinmun Saturday observes in a by-lined commentary in this regard:
					
					This is a crafty and dangerous scheme that can be conceived only by those keen to escalate the confrontation with the DPRK and ignite a war of aggression against it.
					
					 Their plan to turn the five islands and waters off them into tourist destinations brings to light their ulterior aims because those islands are fraught with such tension that an armed conflict may break out again any moment.
					
					 In a word, they seek to cover up their bellicose nature and intensify their moves to launch a war against the DPRK under the signboard of "international tourism."
					
					 Troops of the north and the south stand in acute confrontation with those five islands in between. It is, therefore, a sinister scenario of the puppet warmongers to use those five islands and waters around them as theatres for kicking off armed provocations with ease and ignite a new war there. 
					
					 War and tourism can never go together. Nevertheless, the puppet forces are keen to build international tourist resorts there. It is needless to say that through these projects they seek to conceal their preparations for a war with a guise of tourism and get the "northern limit line" and their dominium over the waters off the five islands publicly recognized. Also lurking behind their projects is a sinister aim to bring tourists there to use them as "human shields" in a bid to escape the Korean People's Army's retaliation against their military provocations.
					
					 There remains only such physical settlement as exchange of fire between the north and the south due to the group of traitors' hideous provocations. A war knows no mercy, and even tourist resorts can by no means be safe.

articles.title: Minju Joson Blasts Lee Myung Bak Group of Traitors' Anti-DPRK Confrontation Racket
articles.content:
Minju Joson Blasts Lee Myung Bak Group of Traitors' Anti-DPRK Confrontation Racket
 Pyongyang, July 2 (KCNA) -- The Lee Myung Bak group of traitors in south Korea recently perpetrated such hideous provocations as hurting the system and dignity of the DPRK. This goes to prove what dangerous phase its moves to escalate the confrontation with fellow countrymen have reached.
					 Minju Joson Saturday says this in a by-lined commentary:
					
					What the group seeks through the provocations is a sinister aim to spark off an armed conflict between the north and the south and ignite a war of aggression against the north, the commentary notes, and goes on:
					
					 The ulterior motive of the traitor is to deliberately rattle the nerves of the army and people of the DPRK in a bid to spark off an armed clash between the north and the south and start a war of aggression against it under this pretext. Among the successive fascist rulers in south Korea there was no one who did not run wild with confrontation with compatriots. But no one has perpetrated such ceaseless hideous provocations as hurting the dignity of the leadership in the DPRK as the Lee group did.
					
					 Through such unprecedented provocations it brought to light its true colors as maniacs keen on confrontation with compatriots and psychopaths precipitating its own destruction, putting the successive fascist rulers into the shade.
					
					 The above-said hideous provocations are little short of hastening the merciless punishment to be meted by the army and people of the DPRK to it.
					
					 The DPRK has never made an empty talk.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Observes Anniversary of Kim Jong Il's Work
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Observes Anniversary of Kim Jong Il's Work
Pyongyang, July 2 (KCNA) -- Rodong Sinmun Saturday dedicates an article to the 20th anniversary of the publication of General Secretary Kim Jong Il's work "Let Us Firmly Arm Ourselves with the Juche-Oriented Theory of Socialist Economic Management".
					 The work published on July 1, Juche 80 (1991) expounds the main principle of the socialist economic management based on the Juche idea and gives perfect answers to the issues of the system and method of the socialist economic management and theoretical and practical issues arising in establishing the method of the socialist economic management.
					
					 The work serves as a powerful driving force for dynamically pushing forward the building of a socialist economic power, the author of the article notes, and goes on:
					
					 In the DPRK the popular masses are united in their actions on the basis of comradeship with high awareness and ability as masters. Herein lie the essential feature of the socialist society distinguished from the exploiting society and the main engine for the socialist economic development.
					
					 The Juche-oriented method of economic management makes it possible for the popular masses to perform their responsibility and role as masters by combining the party's unitary leadership, the state's centralist and planned guidance with the mass line. Its advantages have been clearly proved in the course of the Korean people's struggle crowned with epoch-making miracles and victories. 
					
					 The revolutionary character, the scientific accuracy and tremendous vitality of the Workers' Party of Korea's theory of socialist economic management are more strikingly demonstrated in the on-going general onward movement.
					
					 The drive for a great surge is sure to triumph thanks to the Juche-oriented idea of economic management clarified by the WPK and the people who enshrine its validity and vitality as their faith and life and soul, concludes the article.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Calls for Throwing Overboard Lee Myung Bak Group
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Calls for Throwing Overboard Lee Myung Bak Group
 Pyongyang, July 2 (KCNA) -- The Lee Myung Bak group is the arch criminal that has brought the inter-Korean relations to collapse and escalated tension on the Korean Peninsula and the root cause of national disasters.
					Rodong Sinmun Saturday observes this in a bylined article.
					
					 It goes on:
					
					 The present ruling forces of south Korea, utterly indifferent to the interests of the country and nation, have rejected the reconciliation and unity between the north and the south of Korea and frantically pursued confrontation and war in pursuit of their ulterior aims since the very day they came to power.
					
					 The true nature of the south Korean conservative group's confrontation racket against the DPRK is the confrontation of systems aimed at invading the DPRK. 
					
					 As soon as traitor Lee Myung Bak took power, he was busy everyday holding confrontation confabs betraying his extreme hostility toward fellow countrymen and cried out for "fighting the north till sure victory."
					
					 The Lee Myung Bak group is ready to perpetrate any political and military provocation without hesitation if it will help realize its wild ambition to invade the north.
					
					 The Lee group is keen only on escalating the confrontation and realizing its ambition for invading the north utterly indifferent to the destiny of the country and nation. If the group is allowed to stay in power, all fellow countrymen will not escape from terrible war disasters, much less achieving national reunification and prosperity, concludes the article.

articles.title: US Forces Criticized for Concealing Burial of Toxic Chemicals in S. Korea
articles.content:
US Forces Criticized for Concealing Burial of Toxic Chemicals in S. Korea
						
 Pyongyang, July 2 (KCNA) -- The U.S. imperialist aggression forces in south Korea was disclosed to have concealed the environmental pollution in their military base in Waegwan, Chilgok County, North Kyongsang Province, according to Internet broadcasting service "Voice of People" on June 28.
					 This was disclosed in a report submitted to the U.S. military base in Taegu by the U.S. engineering corps in February.
					
					 According to the report, a hole 25 m in length, 14 m in width and 6 m in depth was found in 2004 to contain poisonous chemical material in the military base in Waegwan and the examination of soil there proved that it was contaminated by carcinogenic material.
					
					 Dioxin, toxic component of defoliant, was also detected, the report said.
					
					 A lawmaker from the Democratic Labor Party, disclosing the report on June 27, said the size of the hole is almost the same as what witnesses mentioned in their testimonies. It is likely that the toxic chemical material still remains buried in the place.

articles.title: US Introduction of Armored Vehicles to S. Korea Denounced
articles.content:
US Introduction of Armored Vehicles to S. Korea Denounced
 Pyongyang, July 2 (KCNA) -- The U.S. imperialist aggression forces introduced more than 50 latest-type Bradley armored vehicles and other war hardware to south Korea on June 29, according to south Korean Yonhap News.
					 Those hardware entered through Pusan Port and they are planned to be deployed to U.S. units in south Korea.
					
					 The U.S. is arming its forces with new preemptive attack weapons in a bid to launch a war on the Korean Peninsula.

articles.title: S. Korea's Plan to Introduce Helicopter Protested
articles.content:
S. Korea's Plan to Introduce Helicopter Protested
 Pyongyang, July 2 (KCNA) -- The People for Achieving Peace and Reunification of south Korea on June 28 thrust a written protest to the Defense Agency against the plan to introduce large helicopter gunships that may stoke the danger of a war.
					 The written protest accused the agency of mulling introducing gunships under the pretext of "clearing the people of fear" and "deterring provocation". 
					
					 The plan is aimed to foster military conflict between the north and the south of Korea and push the situation to the brink, it said.
					
					 It called for an immediate stop to the moves to spend huge taxes collected from the people for purchasing war hardware.

articles.title: S. Korean Hospital's Abuses of Women Denounced
articles.content:
S. Korean Hospital's Abuses of Women Denounced
 Pyongyang, July 2 (KCNA) -- 19 women's organizations in south Korea, including the Federation of Women Organizations and the Women's Committee of the Confederation of Trade Unions, hit out at the management of Kyongsan Samsung Hospital for its human rights abuses. They held a press conference in front of the building of the Human Rights Committee on June 28. 
					 The speakers accused the hospital management of dismissing women workers en masse and hurling hooligans into committing sexual violence against women union members protesting against the measure.
					
					 They branded it as serious human rights abuses against women.
					
					 A press release urged the "government" and the Human Rights Committee to fully investigate the sexual violence by the hospital side and hooligans and probe the truth.
					
					 It said the progressive forces would work hard to check violence against women.

articles.title: British Branch of KFA Terms US Provoker of Korean War
articles.content:
British Branch of KFA Terms US Provoker of Korean War
 Pyongyang, July 2 (KCNA) -- The British Branch of the Korean Friendship Association (KFA) issued a statement on June 25 to mark the beginning of the month of international solidarity with the Korean people.
					 The Korean War started by the U.S. imperialists was a war of massacre of the Korean people, the statement said, disclosing the U.S. nature as aggressor.
					
					 What they sought through the war was to put the whole Korean Peninsula under their control and use it as a springboard for their world domination, the statement said.
					
					 They ruthlessly butchered the Koreans and unhesitatingly used internationally banned germ weapons and chemical weapons during the war, it noted.
					
					 The British Branch together with all other branches of the KFA calls for the U.S. forces' unconditional and complete withdrawal from south Korea, it added.
					
					 The U.S. should repeal all its hostile policy toward the DPRK and replace the Korean Armistice Agreement with a lasting peace agreement, the statement urged.

articles.title: International Meeting Supports Korea's Reunification
articles.content:
International Meeting Supports Korea's Reunification 
 Pyongyang, July 2 (KCNA) -- A resolution on solidarity with the DPRK was adopted at the third meeting of the International Union of Agricultural and Foodstuff Workers. It was held in France from June 21 to 24.
					 The resolution denounced the U.S. hostile policy toward the DPRK and joint military exercises staged by the U.S. and south Korea against the DPRK. It strongly called for the U.S. forces' withdrawal from south Korea.
					
					 It urged the present south Korean authorities to respect the historic June 15 North-South Joint Declaration and the October 4 declaration and expressed full support for the Korean people in their efforts for peace and reunification of the Korean Peninsula.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Work Posted on Internet Homepage by Swiss Organization
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Work Posted on Internet Homepage by Swiss Organization
 Pyongyang, July 2 (KCNA) -- The Swiss Group for the Study of the Juche Idea on June 27 posted on its Internet homepage the full text of President Kim Il Sung's work "The Path of the Korean Revolution". 
					 The work, published on June 30, Juche 29 (1930), clarifies the fundamental stand and attitude to be maintained by the communists in the revolutionary struggle, the character and tasks of the Korean revolution and the Juche-based line and policies for successfully carrying out the Korean revolution.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Death Anniversary Commemorated Abroad
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Death Anniversary Commemorated Abroad
 Pyongyang, July 2 (KCNA) -- Nigerian and Peruvian organizations posted special write-ups on Internet homepages on the 17th anniversary of the demise of President Kim Il Sung.
					 The Nigerian National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea in the article "Respect for President Kim Il Sung" on June 23 said it has become part of life for the Korean people to express their respect for the President.
					
					 In Pyongyang there is the Kumsusan Memorial Palace where the President lies in state, the article said, adding:
					
					General Secretary Kim Jong Il saw to it that the Kumsusan Assembly Hall, where the President worked during his lifetime, was spruced up as the Kumsusan Memorial Palace, the sacred temple of Juche, firmly determined to continue upholding the President as in his lifetime.
					
					 He also made sure that the Juche year and the Day of the Sun were set and Kim Il Sung was upheld as the eternal President of socialist Korea.
					
					 He has led the army and people of the DPRK to building a thriving nation true to the President's idea and cause, the article said, stressing that the President is alive amid boundless reverence of the Korean people.
					
					 The Peruvian-Korean Institute of Culture and Friendship posted a video introducing the Kumsusan Memorial Palace on Internet homepage on June 8.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Exploits Praised by Foreigners
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Exploits Praised by Foreigners
 Pyongyang, July 2 (KCNA) -- Humberto Vargas Carbonel, general secretary of the Central Committee of the People's Vanguard of Costa Rica, released a statement on June 25 on the 17th anniversary of the demise of President Kim Il Sung.
					 The world revolutionary parties and progressive people look back with feelings of deep reverence and emotion on the exploits of the President, who devoted his all to the reunification of the country till the last moments of his great life, the general secretary said, and went on:
					
					 The President advanced the three principles of national reunification, the ten-point programme of the great unity of the entire nation and the proposal for founding the Democratic Federal Republic of Koryo.
					
					 Cuautemoc Amezcua Dromundo, chairman of the Central Committee of the Socialist Popular Party of Mexico, released a statement titled "Believe in people as in Heaven, political idea of President Kim Il Sung" on June 23.
					
					 The President's life was devoted to the people, the statement said, praising him as a paragon of the people's leaders.
					
					 It praised the President for having worked for the people from the days of building a new country till the last moments of his life, adding his idea of believing in people as in Heaven will be immortal.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Praised
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Praised 
Pyongyang, July 2 (KCNA) -- A regional organization and Swiss organization posted commemorative articles on Internet homepages on the 47th anniversary of General Secretary Kim Jong Il's start of work at the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea.
					 The International Alliance of Societies for the Study of the Juche Idea and Songun Policy in East European and Central Asian Regions on June 20 posted an article titled "Children are kings of the country" with a photo of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The phrase "children are kings of the country" reflects the nature of socialist Korea led by Kim Jong Il, the article said, telling about the loving care and benevolence shown by him for children.
					
					 The Alliance also posted an article titled "Plan of Workers' Party of Korea" on June 24.
					
					 The Swiss Group for the Study of the Juche Idea in an article on June 5 said Kim Jong Il's start of work at the WPK Central Committee on June 19, 1964 was an event of great historic significance in successfully carrying forward the undying revolutionary exploits of President Kim Il Sung.
					
					 Kim Jong Il invariably held aloft socialist banner despite the complicated international situation and turned the DPRK into a politico-ideological power and a military power, the article said.
					
					 The progressive humankind is praising him as an elder statesman of the world who built the DPRK into a power in the East, it added.

articles.title: Nepalese Newspaper Explains Juche Idea
articles.content:
Nepalese Newspaper Explains Juche Idea
 Pyongyang, July 2 (KCNA) -- The Nepalese newspaper Arpan devoted a page to an article explaining the Juche idea on June 24. It carried a photo of President Kim Il Sung.
					 The paper carried questions and answers to elaborate on the originality and philosophical principle of the Juche idea, the Juche-oriented view on the world based on it, the reason why man becomes a social being possessed of independence, creativity and consciousness and the law governing man's domination of the world and its change and development.

articles.title: Anniversary of CPC Marked in China
articles.content:
Anniversary of CPC Marked in China
 Beijing, July 1 (KCNA) -- The Chinese newspaper Renmin Ribao Friday dedicated an editorial to the 90th birthday of the Communist Party of China.
					 The CPC was founded nine decades ago when the Chinese people were at the crossroads of life and death, the editorial said, adding this great event completely changed the features of the Chinese revolution and led China to a new future.
					
					 It further said:
					
					 After its foundation the CPC rallied and led the Chinese people to build new China where the people become masters. It also established the basic socialist system, independent and comparatively perfect industrial system and national economic system and opened the road to socialism with Chinese characteristics, a signal achievement to be recorded in history, and brought about great changes.
					
					 The truth remains unchanged in 90 years of adversity and trials that there is no new China without the CPC and the looks of China were renewed thanks to it. The belief has been hardened that the people are just the basis, lifeline and strength of the Party.
					
					 Eternal devoted service for the people can help record a new chapter honorable for the history, the forerunners and the times, the editorial said, calling upon all the people to work hard in face of any danger and challenge, closely rallied around the CPC Central Committee with Hu Jintao as its general secretary, and advance toward the beautiful future of the socialist cause with Chinese characteristics and a great prosperity of the Chinese people.

articles.title: Exhibition Opened to Celebrate Anniversary of CPC
articles.content:
Exhibition Opened to Celebrate Anniversary of CPC
						
 Beijing, July 1 (KCNA) -- An exhibition on the theme of "Everything for the people" was opened in Beijing on June 26 on the occasion of the 90th anniversary of the founding of the Communist Party of China.
					 Displayed in the exhibition were more than 1,500 photos and over 400 relics, etc. impressively showing the 90-year-long history of the CPC.

articles.title: Art Exhibition Marking CPC's 90th Founding Anniversary Opens in Beijing
articles.content:
Art Exhibition Opens in Beijing to Mark CPC Anniversary
 Beijing, July 1 (KCNA) -- A  fine art exhibition opened at the Chinese Art Museum in Beijing on Monday to commemorate the 90th anniversary of the Communist Party of China (CPC).
					 Nearly 300 art works dealing with the history of the CPC are on display at the exhibition sponsored by the Ministry of Culture.
					
					 The exhibition will last till July 18.

articles.title: Exhibition Featuring CPC's Rural Policies Opens in China
articles.content:
Exhibition Featuring CPC's Rural Policies Opens in China
 Beijing, July 1 (KCNA) -- The exhibition, a retrospection on the rural policies since the founding of the Communist Party of China, opened at the National Agriculture Exhibition Center on June 26.
					 The exhibition deals with the CPC's policies and proposals on the issues relating to agriculture, the countryside and farmers in the periods of the agrarian revolution, the anti-Japanese war, the liberation war and the recovery of national economy and the socialist transformation. It also introduces the course along which China has maintained the road of agricultural modernization with Chinese characteristics since the 16th Congress of the CPC.

articles.title: Gala Held to Commemorate CPC 90th Anniversary
articles.content:
Gala Held to Commemorate CPC Anniversary 
 Beijing, July 1 (KCNA) --  A gala "Our Flag" was staged with splendor at the Great Hall of the People in Beijing on June 29 to mark the 90th anniversary of the Communist Party of China. 
					 President Hu Jintao and other senior officials of China joined an audience of more than 6,000 people from all walks of life in the city.
					
					 The performers put on the stage songs "No New China without CPC", "Socialism Is Good" and other art works depicting the foundation of the CPC and its development and reflecting the will of the Chinese people to always follow the party.

articles.title: National Meeting of Security Organs Held in China
articles.content:
National Meeting of Security Organs Held in China
 Beijing, July 1 (KCNA) -- A national meeting of public security organs was held in Beijing on June 27 to commemorate the 90th birthday of the Communist Party of China.
					 Meng Jianzhu, state councilor and minister of Public Security, said in his speech that public security organs and officials throughout the country should inherit and display the good traditions of the Party. He also called on them to defend and promote the cause of socialism with Chinese characteristics.

articles.title: China Refutes Japan's Wrong Assertion
articles.content:
China Refutes Japan's Wrong Assertion
						
 Beijing, July 1 (KCNA) -- A spokesperson for the Chinese Foreign Ministry at a news briefing on June 28 clarified the stand of his government rejecting the wrong assertion of Japan.
					 Some days ago, an official of the Japanese government claimed that a Chinese ship for scientific research conducted a maritime survey in the exclusive economic waters of Japan without its permission. The spokesperson vehemently refuted this story.
					
					 The ship made no survey while sailing to the open sea via the economic waters of Japan in order to survey maritime environment, the spokesperson stressed.

articles.title: China Calls for Combat against Corruption
articles.content:
China Calls for Combat against Corruption 
						
 Beijing, July 1 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the Central Commission for Discipline Inspection of the Communist Party of China at a recent press conference called for steadily holding fast to the combat against corruption and promoting integrity.
					 He said that the 90-year-long history of the CPC proved that to step up the party building was one of the important treasures that made it possible to win steady victories, weathering all difficulties, he added.
					
					 What is important in combating corruption and promoting integrity this year is to strengthen the control and inspection of the implementation of the spirit of the Fifth Plenary Meeting of the 17th C.C., the CPC and the 12th Five-Year Plan, establish the party's work style and provide a system for punishing and preventing corruption cases.

articles.title: New Sections of Subway Opened to Traffic in Guangdong Province, China
articles.content:
New Sections of Subway Opened to Traffic in Guangdong Province, China
 Beijing, July 1 (KCNA) -- The projects for Sections No. 2 and 3 of the subway were completed and opened to traffic in Shenzhen City, Guangdong Province, China on June 28.
					 The total length of these sections is 156 km.
					
					 The projects were completed in a matter of four years and half.

articles.title: Leader of Japan's SDP Blasts Japan-US Agreement
articles.content:
Leader of Japan's SDP Blasts Japan-US Agreement
 Pyongyang, July 2 (KCNA) -- The leader of the Social-Democratic Party of Japan at a press conference on June 24 accused the Japanese and U.S governments of reaching an agreement on the plan for transfer of the U.S. Air Force Base in Futenma, Okinawa Prefecture to Henoko, Nago City in the same prefecture.
					 The Japanese government's position on the transfer of the base within the prefecture runs diametrically counter to public opinion, he charged.
					
					 He urged the government to stand on the side of the inhabitants of the prefecture.

articles.title: Japanese Government's Popularity Steadily Sinks
articles.content:
Japanese Government's Popularity Steadily Sinks 
 Pyongyang, July 2 (KCNA) -- The present Japanese government's popularity is steadily sinking due to its wrong policy.
					 The support rate for the government dropped 10.2 percent as compared with that during the opinion poll conducted early in June, according to the results of a national opinion poll conducted by Kyodo News on June 28 and 29.

articles.title: Japan Hit by Heat
articles.content:
Japan Hit by Heat 
 Pyongyang, July 2 (KCNA) -- Various parts of Japan were hit by heat recently. 
					 Temperature went up as high as 39.8 degrees centigrade in Kumagaya, Saitama Prefecture, on June 24.
					
					 Due to the high temperature 51 people were carried to hospitals.

articles.title: Cuban Media Denounce S. Korea's Military Exercises
articles.content:
Cuban Media Denounce S. Korea's Military Exercises
 Pyongyang, July 2 (KCNA) -- Cuban media denounced south Korea's war exercises on June 27.
					 Granma carried an article titled "South Korea stages military exercises in areas along the Military Demarcation Line close to the DPRK". It carried a photo of south Korean troops in exercises.
					
					 The south Korean army stages the said war exercises this week, it said, and went on:
					
					 The military exercises will increase the tension between the north and the south of Korea. 
					
					 South Korea regularly holds military exercises in all areas and wages joint exercises with the U.S.
					
					 Tens of thousands of U.S. troops are present in south Korea, the paper noted.
					
					 The Prensa Latina News Agency and Radio Reloj also reported the news of the military exercises on the same day.

articles.title: Cuba Refutes US Accusations
articles.content:
Cuba Refutes US Accusations
 Havana, July 1 (KCNA) -- The Cuban Foreign Ministry in a statement on June 28 strongly refuted the U.S. accusations against the country.
					 Recently the U.S. in a report included Cuba in the list of countries with the most serious flesh traffic. The statement termed this as the most virulent insult to the Cuban people.
					
					 Cuba is neither source nor relay centre of slave trade, it noted.

articles.title: Russia Beefs up Its Naval Force
articles.content:
Russia Beefs up Naval Force
 Moscow, July 1 (KCNA) -- Russia has steadily directed big efforts to beefing up its naval force.
					 The combined shipbuilding company of Russia said on June 29 that it would commission 17 warships of various types ranging from nuclear-powered submarine to surface warship for the navy till the end of this year and is planning to build two 955-type nuclear-powered submarines of the fourth generation.

articles.title: Azerbaijan President Calls for Peaceful Settlement of Disputes
articles.content:
Azerbaijan President Calls for Peaceful Settlement of Disputes
						
 Pyongyang, July 2 (KCNA) -- Azerbaijan President Ilham Aliyev, in his speech at the military parade celebrating the army day on June 26, called for peaceful settlement of Nagorno-Karabakh dispute. 
					 Azerbaijan wants the peaceful settlement of this dispute, he said, adding that he would make diplomatic efforts to coordinate the dispute.

articles.title: Ukrainian FM on Talks with Member States of Customs Union
articles.content:
Ukrainian FM on Talks with Member States of Customs Union
 Pyongyang, July 2 (KCNA) -- Ukrainian Foreign Minister Konstantin Grishchenko on a TV show on June 24 referred to the talks with member states of the Customs Union. 
					 Saying that the talks with the union member states including Russia are a process to find a way for establishing relations suited to the interests of the country, he expressed Ukraine's stand to develop the relations with the member states.

articles.title: Nigeria Prepares to Launch Two Earth Observation Satellites
articles.content:
Nigeria Prepares to Launch Two Earth Observation Satellites
						
 Pyongyang, July 2 (KCNA) -- Nigeria has concluded plans to launch into orbit two satellites on July 7, a top government official with the country's National Space Research and Development Agency (NASRDA) has said. Those earth observation satellites will contribute to the nation's development of space science and technology, he added.

articles.title: Panama Builds More Hydropower Plants
articles.content:
Panama Builds More Hydropower Plants 
 Pyongyang, July 2 (KCNA) -- Panama is currently building more than a dozen hydropower plants as part of efforts to achieve energy self-sufficiency and stabilize electricity prices.
					 A total of 16 hydropower plants are under construction in the west of the central American country till 2015, with an investment of about 1 billion U.S. dollars.

articles.title: No-smoking Measure Takes Effect in El Salvador
articles.content:
No-smoking Measure Takes Effect in El Salvador
						
 Pyongyang, July 2 (KCNA) -- The Parliament of El Salvador adopted a law on controlling tobacco on June 23.
					 The law bans smoking at hospitals, airports, cinema houses and other public places.
					
					 About 5,000 people are dying in the country every year due to smoking, a news report said.

articles.title: Israeli Army Arrests 11 Palestinians
articles.content:
Israeli Army Arrests 11 Palestinians
 Pyongyang, July 2 (KCNA) -- The Israeli army is busy arresting Palestinians despite the protest and denunciation of the international community.
					 The Israeli forces arrested 11 Palestinians in the West Bank, including a Hamas member of parliament (MP), on Tuesday.

articles.title: Iran Blasts Westerners' Jet Fuel Boycott
articles.content:
Iran Blasts Westerners' Jet Fuel Boycott
 Tehran, July 1 (KCNA) -- Tehran blasted some western countries for refusing to supply fuel to Iranian airliners under the guise of unilateral sanctions.
					 "The refusal of certain Western countries to refuel passenger planes is an inhumane move which runs counter to international regulations because countries are committed to provide passenger planes with required fuel," Iranian Foreign Ministry Spokesman Ramin Mehman-Parast told reporters at his weekly press conference in Tehran on Tuesday.
					
					 It is a politically-motivated move led by certain Western powers, and the United States in particular, with the purpose of "exerting pressure on the Iranian nation," he added. 
					
					 Mehman-Parast stated that it is a "sham imagination" to think that sanctions and pressure would make the Iranian nation stop its way to progress and give up its rights.

articles.title: New Radar System Deployed in Iran
articles.content:
New Radar System Deployed in Iran
 Tehran, July 1 (KCNA) -- Iran is making sustained efforts to boost the defense capability to beat back a possible invasion.
					 A high-ranking commander of the Islamic Revolutionary Guard of Iran said on June 29 that it deployed recently a radar system, the first of its kind in the country, capable of detecting aerial targets and planes, cruise and ballistic missiles and low orbit satellites hard to detect, in particular.
					
					 The range of its performance is radius of 1,100 km and altitude of 300 km, a news report said.

articles.title: Missile Test-fire in Iran
articles.content:
Missile Test-fire in Iran
 Tehran, July 1 (KCNA) -- At least 10 medium- and long-range missiles were successfully test-fired in Iran on June 27 and 28.
					 Shahab-1, Shahab-2, Shahab-3, Fateh-110 and other missiles were launched during the war games, dubbed "Great Prophet 6", a television broadcasting service of the country said.

articles.title: Accidents in US, Japan
articles.content:
Accidents in US, Japan
						
 Pyongyang, July 2 (KCNA) -- A tour bus rear-ended into a tractor-trailer in U.S. State of Pennsylvania Monday, killing the driver and leaving at least 24 others injured.
					 Five people including three children were found dead Tuesday morning following a fire that broke out in a three-story house in Kurashiki, Okayama Prefecture, Japan.

articles.title: Drugs Seized in Algeria
articles.content:
Drugs Seized in Algeria
 Pyongyang, July 2 (KCNA) -- Algerian security services managed to foil an attempt to smuggle 67 kg drugs on the border with Morocco on June 27.
					 The security services had seized 23.5 tons of drugs since the beginning of the year.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il presencia función de grupo artístico de Unidad 963
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il presencia función de grupo artístico de Unidad 963 
Pyongyang, 2 de julio (ATCC) -- El Dirigente   Kim Jong Il, Secretario General del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Presidente del Comité de Defensa Nacional de la República Popular Democrática de Corea y Comandante Supremo del Ejército Popular de Corea, presenció la función del grupo de propaganda artística de la Unidad 963 del EPC.
					Los ejecutantes pusieron en la escena el solo masculino y coro "Ha venido el Líder a nuestro puesto militar", el coro femenino acompañado de Oungum (instrumento musical coreano) "El camino al frente de mil ríes recorrido por el General", la charla cómica "Es mejor la vida de la compañía", el coro masculino "Ordene, Líder" y otras piezas.
					
					A través de la función, ellos demostraron bien el poderío invicto del EPC, la férrea convicción y la voluntad de los militares del EPC de defender a costa de la vida la Dirección de la Revolución y de llevar a feliz término con las fuerzas armadas la causa revolucionaria del Juche iniciada en la selva del Paektu.
					
					Mostraron claramente el poderío de los artistas militares quienes infunden en cada corazón de los militares el ardiente amor a la patria y al pueblo y cumplen la sagrada misión de trompetero de la época del Songun.
					
					Al ver la función, los espectadores sintieron el firme juramento de los oficiales y soldados del EPC, de aniquilar a la banda de traidores surcoreanos con los fusiles de represalia y anticipar a toda costa la histórica causa de la reunificación de la patria, unidos con más firmeza en torno a la Dirección de la Revolución haciendo frente a los cada día más crecientes tejemanejes de los maniacos de enfrentamiento que niegan el digno sistema socialista de la RPDC y se atreven a provocarse a ésta.
					
					Al término de la función, el Dirigente respondió a las efusivas aclamaciones de los ejecutantes y espectadores y felicitó el éxito de función.
					
					   Se mostró muy satisfecho de que los miembros del grupo de propaganda artística de la Unidad hayan ofrecido la magnifica función con las obras de gran importancia cognoscitiva y educativa que reflejan sinceramente el noble mundo espiritual del EPC y les agradeció evaluando altamente el éxito de su función.
					
					   Es muy importante la propaganda artística de gran influencia y alto carácter llamativo en la educación de los militares en la ideología, señaló y presentó las tareas que servirán de guía para activar las actividades de propaganda artística revolucionaria y combativa.
					
					Le acompañaron en verla los cuadros directivos de los órganos del partido y las fuerzas armadas:     Kim Jong Un, Ri Yong Ho, Kim Ki Nam, Jang Song Thaek, Kim Jong Gak, U Tong Chuk y Ri Myong Su, los miembros de la Comisión Militar Central del PTC, Kim Kyong Ok, Kim Won Hong, Kim Yong Chol y Yun Jong Rin, y el jefe de departamento del CDN, Hyon Chol Hae.

articles.title: Choe Yong Rim recorre el Complejo Termoeléctrico de Pukchang
articles.content:
Choe Yong Rim recorre el Complejo Termoeléctrico de Pukchang
Pyongyang, 2 de julio (ATCC) -- El premier coreano Choe Yong Rim averiguó sobre el terreno el estado de producción de la electricidad del Complejo Termoeléctrico de Pukchang. 
					Tras recorrer varios lugares del Complejo convocó una reunión de consulta.
					
					En la ocasión se abordaron los temas de concentrar las fuerzas en la administración de equipos y la dirección técnica y de asegurar suficientemente los materiales y materias primas por las unidades correspondientes, y se tomaron concretas medidas para aumentar la producción de energía eléctrica.

articles.title: En Pyongyang grupo de turistas de de Shanghai
articles.content:
En Pyongyang grupo de turistas de de Shanghai
						
Pyongyang, 2 de julio (ATCC) -- Arribó el día primero a esta capital por vía aérea el grupo de turistas de Shanghai encabezado por Shi Quanxing, jefe de la sucursal del Partido Comunista de China de la Compañía Ltd. de Turismo Shanghai-Kumgang de China. 
					Es primera vez el turismo a Corea de los chinos por vía aérea internacional Pyongyang-Shanghai.
					
					En esa jornada de 4 noches y 5 días los turistas visitarán las creaciones monumentales de Pyongyang, la Exposición Permanente de Amistad Internacional, Phanmunjom y otros lugares.
					
					También recorrerán el monte Kumgang de fama mundial y los vestigios históricos de la zona de Kaesong. 
					
					El director general de la Agencia de Turismo Internacional de Corea, Jo Song Gyu (de 46 años de edad) dijo a la ATCC que se activará más en el futuro el turismo de los chinos a los famosos lugares de Corea incluso el monte Kumgang.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun denuncia "plan de desarrollo general de 5 islas"
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun denuncia "plan de desarrollo general de 5 islas"
Pyongyang, 2 de julio (ATCC) -- Recientemente los títeres surcoreanos dieron a la publicidad el "plan de desarrollo general de las 5 islas del Mar Oeste", cuyo contenido principal es acondicionar las 5 islas del Mar Oeste como una zona turística internacional. 
					Esto es una artimaña astuta y peligrosa de los enloquecidos por la confrontación fratricida y la provocación de guerra de agresión contra la República Popular Democrática de Corea.
					
					Revela el rotativo Rodong Sinmun en un comentario individual de este sábado y prosigue:
					
					Los títeres surcoreanos intentan desarrollar el polo turístico en una zona delicada donde puede ocurrir un conflicto armado en cualquier momento e intensificar las maniobras de provocación de guerra de agresión a la RPDC con el fin de encubrir su naturaleza belicosa bajo el rótulo del turismo internacional y obtener el reconocimiento internacional sobre la "línea de límite al Norte" y su posesión de la zona marítima de esas 5 islas del Mar Oeste. Además, tratan de formar un escudo humano con turistas para evadir el contraataque de represalia de la RPDC.
					
					La guerra no se armoniza con el turismo.
					
					Debido a las provocaciones nunca tolerables de la banda de traidores surcoreanos, sólo queda el saldo físico de armas en las relaciones Norte-Sur. 
					
					La guerra no dispensa la piedad ni excluye la zona  disfrazada de turismo.
